intro: Acosta beltrani, commonly known as the Beltrani's acosta, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
